Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramona R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very average; no coffeemaker in room so had to request it! Iron was broken, furniture knicked and worn, doors and walls dirty...desperately needs a deep cleaning!! Breakfast was very average!! I had a small international group staying here and was embarrassed! Wouldn't go back unless I did an inspection.

Reviews.Title: “Totally positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: ClarkCreek
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with this Homewood Suites since we were looking for a clean, safe, non-smoking hotel off the strip. We stayed at this newer hotel 3 nights in March and didn’t have any problems. Staff and customer service in all respects were excellent! The evening meals were great and the host was extremely friendly, even bringing hot cookies and sodas/water directly to you at your table. The one negative was that morning breakfast staff was not very good at refreshing the food during the last 35 minutes of the breakfast period. We returned our rental car late the evening before an early morning flight, which was possible because we were able to walk back to the hotel and then take a 4:00 a.m. shuttle to the airport. Airplane noise was not a problem during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Barbaradee1959
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms with all the bells and whistles. Suite with full refrigerator, dishwasher, and cook top. Excellent morning breakfast served with several hot food items. A courtesy van takes the traveler to the airport or to Mandalay Bay. The front desk is efficient, friendly, and informative. We found the hotel very quiet despite being close to the airport. I would not hesitate staying at this Homewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathrooms and no empathy”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack021
Reviews.Content: I hate to write a bad review of any hotel that has their heart in the right place but after the bad stay that I had at Homewood suites, I feel that I must.... Hopefully the management will read this review and take action. I stayed there over NYE weekend b/c my trip was a last minute plan. I was pleased to see that for a airport type hotel/motel that it was what I expected. Pleasant check in, nice staff but the service was dreadful. After the first day that my room was not cleaned I mentioned to the late night front desk person. I received a "ya, sorry about that, I will make a call". No promise that it would be handled, no call back, no maid ever showed up to clean my room that day or even the next. Bad service ruined what could have been a good stay at a budget motel.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites is my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freq_business_travlr
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel upon arrival at the airport to see when the shuttle picked up there. They dispatched a driver, Louie, within 20 minutes and I arrived at the hotel 10 minutes later around 1 PM. Even though it was before the official check-in time of 3 PM, the hotel clerk on duty was most accommodating in allowing me to check in early. This hotel is almost new, having been built in 2008, and still looks and feels new. It has a very similar layout to most of the other newer Homewood Suites where I've stayed previously. Pros: - Complete kitchen with full-size refrigerator, dishwasher, sink, 2-burner stove, and microwave. - Clean quiet rooms with flat-screen TV's with good selection of channels - Free wired Internet access - Free on-site parking - Complimentary daily breakfasts are also a plus, with rotating menu items including scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, waffles, cold and hot cereal, fruits, yogurt, and a variety of beverages. - Complimentary light dinners Monday through Thursday only, but alas no beer and wine like most other Homewood Suites where I've stayed. Cons: - As other reviewers have noted, the HVAC units are rather noisy, but since I had a 2-room suite with a separate HVAC unit in each room, I used the unit in the living area during the night to minimize the noise in the bedroom. - Depending on which way planes are taking off at the airport and if you have a room facing the airport, there is some additional noise from that, but not so much it interrupts your sleep. However, I rather enjoyed watching the planes take off and land, so it was not a concern for me. Homewood Suites is my favorite hotel wherever I travel, and I would certainly not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ricflairnwa
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel away from the strip, no gambling on site. Place was quiet and our room was spotless. We were surprised at how much room we had. The room with 2 Queen beds had plenty of extra space for wrestling with my Daughter. Separate LR/BR is great if you have a family. Room had a full size Frig, Micro and even a Stove. Plates and Silverware and 2 flat screens help make this a Gemm of a Hotel. The front desk staff were always pleasant and helpful and the housekeeping staff were exceptional. Breakfast was very convenient and we were pleased with the variety and it was always warm and well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: thingamabobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late December for one night. Had I known it would have met our needs and been such great value I would have stayed longer. We thought it was a great place with kids as quiet with no casinos and ideal for stlll getting into the strip with free shuttle bus to Mandalay Bay. The rooms are lovely, really clean and look recently refurbished. We didn't use the pool or hot tub or gym but all looked good. Breakfast was included and there was complimentary dinner. It was salad with a chicken burger. As I said, great value overall. If I was going to Vegas again with kids I'd stay here over a hotel on the strip. The service was excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous49463
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my family during New Year's eve time and the stay was great. They provided Dinner one evening (that we know of) and was pretty decent. Their Breakfast was so busy due to hotel being full but the staff were great at refilling all the items as soon as they can. Kudos to them. Rooms and hotel were very clean. Location was great, not close to the strip but if you have a car it is only about 1.5 miles or so to the strip. You can get onto 215 in less than 2 minutes and is 5 min to the Airport. The best part I liked -- We wanted to go to New Year's eve but the strip will be closed for vehicles and hotels won't let you park cars if you are not a guest on the strip hotel. What do we do, pay $30 for off strip parking places (that sprang up the same day) or stay in the room. I called the hotel and they said we will drop you and pick you up all night in a parking lot at the end of the strip. Voila, we enjoyed it and had someone drive us home (ok, hotel) after we partied on the strip until 2 AM. Couple of things I didn't like -- Wireless internet was very slow at 10kbps and when I explained this to the front desk he said 'wow, that is really slow' but didn't do anything about it. They installed some software to control tracking and have good experience for their computer users. Uniguest program was blocking every page we tried to look for shows available tonight. I explained this to him and he was like 'I will let them know' but didn't move an inch. I guess customer service wasn't his thing:) I would recommend this place anytime. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Last Minute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwuams
Reviews.Content: Due to unexpected circumstances, we were forced to find a hotel in Las Vegas on New Years Eve. Not easy to do and not inexpensive either. But I found this Homewood Suites, that was convenient to the airport for our early flight, and available. From staying in others of the chain for business, I knew what to expect. The shuttle ran ontime, every hour to the airport and on every half hour to the Mandalay Bay. Very quiet as I never heard another guest or an airplane from the nearby airport. Since we were there on the weekend, didn't get to try the evening snacks or even the morning breakfast, since it didn't start until 7am. Staff was friendly and helpful and the shuttle driver was friendly too (yes he is from Hawaii).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location near airport.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia3bears
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is located within sight of McCarren Airport in Las Vegas. Since it is a suite set-up...you have a small kitchen, dining table, sofa, TV's etc. This was a pleasant alternative to the very pricey hotels on the strip. Our stay was three nights. Complimentary breakfast was excellent. We did not attend but we we invited to a reception of light meal and beverage, Monday through Thursday evenings. Our only negative was that the heat/cool system was very noisy and seemed worked in the bedroom and not in the sitting room. Also elevators are in odd locations if you have a room in the center of a hallway. Staff was gracious and helped with a printer snag in the Executive center. Rooms were clean, parking convenient, coffee/tea making supplies. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied!!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: GXA-GURL
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival on hawaiian airlines at mid night, called the hotel for shuttle pick up! Shuttle drive Anthony was very out spoken, very formative, friendly, job well done especially coming from HAWAII :)!! Checking in @ the hotel F/D Dhal was very welcoming! :) Made us feel @ home!!! Jayson who I spoke many times bout our rooms n bags was very patient!!! Thanks guys for doing a GREAT job!!!! Definetly will return to this HOTEL again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Derrynane
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here on our first night in Las Vegas and pick up the hire car next day. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to and from the airport and to and from the strip which saved a fortune in taxis. There was also a full free breakfast and a free evening meal on when we arrived (evening meal weekdays only I think). The room was excellent with a lounge and a small kitchen. It was spotlessly clean and very quiet. There was free parking if you wanted it and all the toiletries and coffee/tea making supplies you could think of. Next day when we went to pick up the car for an early get away, the hotel kindly drove us there in the shuttle bus. Excellent service and would highly recommend for either a first night stay or longer.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel...nice location”
Reviews.Author: brebarg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite, with my daughter sleeping on the sofa bed. The room was great, and the staff very helpful. It is really close to the rental car return and the outlet malls. MY only complaint was that the a/c unit was located about 4 feet from my head, and it woke me up sometimes during the night while it cycled on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Always Happy with Hilton”
Reviews.Author: nanasnest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to Bryce Canyon. We booked at the last minute as our flight to Las Vegas was cancelled and we had to change our plans and fly out the next day. I am a Hilton Gold member and have been extremely happy with their product. Always a consistent. I have to admit that I prefer the beds at Hampton Suites to Homewood. The latter beds do not seem as comfortable. The lounge here for breakfast was very pleasant and I think Homewood is great for families. I also appreciate being able to use my points for free hotel stays. Hilton is one of the few brands that always asks me to review their hotels after staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Good service!”
Reviews.Author: Barb M
Reviews.Content: After a horrible experience at the Flamingo Las Vegas, my husband and I were delighted to come across this gem on our last night in Vegas. I really regret that we didn't stay here for our entire visit. The suite we stayed in was clean, fashionable, comfortable and spacious. The bed was super-comfy, the towels were fluffy, and the carpets were clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you're looking for a relaxing place away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great find near airport!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after touring the national parks- returning our hire car (nearby), going down to the strip (free shuttle), and getting an early morning flight- was all made easy by this comfortable hotel. The room was great- loved the kitchen with dishwasher, huge fridge and small table and chairs. The bed was very comfortable and our room, which faced the pool, was quiet. It was great to be in a classy hotel with not a gaming machine in sight!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice,and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Doug F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites at the beginning and end of our national parks loop in Arizona & Utah and it was great! Our suite was very clean and well equipped. The staff was very helpful. Their shuttle takes you to the Mandalay at the south end of the strip & to the airport. The hotel is very close to the rental car complex ( a 5-10 min walk,or they will come pick you up) as we turned in our rental the afternoon before we flew home. The continental breakfast was very good & they even served an evening meal the night before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will be back again>>>>>”
Reviews.Author: saloniki505
Reviews.Content: Service was great,room was cleaned,large as we had the one bedroom,location was great a ride to the strip was short, pool was wonderful also spa, never crowded,amenties were always replenished,I liked the location near everything....will be back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when in Vegas. We love it!”
Reviews.Author: dyana221
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when we're in Vegas. It's clean, convenient with a friendly staff. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The kitchens have everything you would need, including a full size refrigerator, microwave and a dishwasher. The staff keeps you supplied in coffee, sugar, towels, and toiletries. The hotel provides a laundry facility, gym, pool, and breakfast, as well, as during the week they provide an evening meal. The rooms are large and they contain flat-screen TVs in the lounge area and the bedrooms. They have two bedroom suites, which we usually take advantage of, turning one into an office during our stay. I would definitely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Casino Relief”
Reviews.Author: TexanAbroad
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas and you are sick of the neon and glitter, then stay at the Homewood Suites. If you want to avoid feeling like YOU are the casino's ATM, then stay at the Homewood Suites. If you want to feel like a natural traveler in a town that intends to be unnatural, then stay at the Homewood Suites. The price is fair. The rooms are accomodating. The hotel is clean. The breakfast is OK. It is a Homewood Suites...but it is a relief to step away from Las Vegas Blvd. Not completely away, they run a shuttle to the madness...and to the airport. The rental car center is very nearby - which brings me to a big tip if you are flying into Vegas to visit the Grand Canyon or southern California. You can take a day off your car rental by using the Homewood Suite to delay your rental or bring the car back early. We flew in on a cheap flight, stayed at Homewood and then picked up the car the next day...then, when we returned the car, we stayed at Homewood and used their shuttle services and cabs. In all, we saved about $100 off our rental costs. Planning your trip and minimizing your rental car needs saves big bucks. Also, on rental cars, request a compact, and because everyone does you're likely to get upgraded to a midsize or better. Again, the Homewood Suites Airport is Casino Relief for those weary of the Las Vegas glitz. It was just right for Texans abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Real nice place”
Reviews.Author: Freddy62
Reviews.Content: I love having the "homey" feel even when I am away from home and Homewood Suites usually delivers! This particular property was no exception. Very nice rooms, nicely appointed, great ammenities and convenient location (although, far enough away from the Strip that you will need a rental car - or take the shuttle to the south end of the strip).

Reviews.Title: “wished we found this earlier perfect”
Reviews.Author: britoldgit
Reviews.Content: we only stayed one night,our last night in vegas,and wished we had booked this when in vegas at the start of our holiday before traveling on to other places.it is off strip very quite even though next to the airport,you get a free shuttle to the strip a free shuttle to the airport,a breakfast that is free,and very good i might add.and if you have hire a rental car,the rental car return is just down the rd and also there is a petrol station station at the bottom of the rd ,which made every thing so easy.we could not find fault with the hotel or the staff as isaid iwished we had found it earlier would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresofScorch
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel on the basis of distance from rental car pick up address, price (deal from hotels.com) and on line reviews. Hotel suited our purpose which was a place to crash after a long flight from UK. The suite had a mini kitchen with hob, oven, dish washer, fridge. We only used the fridge for drinks. Did not have much interaction with the staff other than booking in, which was smooth and efficient. Room was clean and as expected, the air con was noisy but it was working hard it was 110 degrees F outside. The free wifi had a good connection speed. We did not use the pool or any of the other hotel's facilities.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, we are going to be regulars!”
Reviews.Author: 2bluestarparents
Reviews.Content: Never heard of this property but we found a coupon in our local newspaper. We live 2-hours northeast of Las Vegas in St. George, UT and when we travel by plane, we fly in/out of McCarran airport in Las Vegas. We usually leave a few hours before our flight and park in the remote extended parking (at $8 a day). Our flight to DC was at 6:30 am (LV time) and we just couldn't bear getting up at 2am (UT time) to make our flight. The coupon offered a room for $99 plus up to 14-days of free parking and free transportation to the airport. Seing how we were going to be paying $64 in parking fees anyway we thought this would be a great option. Were we sooo glad we did! This property is AMAZING! The rooms are absolutely beautiful and the beds are heavenly. Too add to the amazing room and free parking, they also served dinner. We have traveled a lot over our 26-years of marriage and we have never seen dinner offered. It was just meatballs, bread & salad with a variety of beverages but it was pretty good. They did have cookies too but we weren't quite qucik enough. We left the hotel before they serve breakfast but they did have coffee and for that, we are thankful. We cannot wait to travel there again. We will be staying there as often as possible. Even if we are just going for a quick weekend away and not just flying out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value off the strip”
Reviews.Author: TommyPeter
Reviews.Content: Spacious clean rooms. Free shuttle to Mandalay Bay and back. NO casinos in hotel was a plus. Nice free breakfast buffet. Recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “As it should be”
Reviews.Author: sasanqua
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just as an overnighter, in a two room suite. Was all in order, staff helpful and efficient. Needed to be at the airport at 4.30 am and free shuttle was on time and well organised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: masl1122
Reviews.Content: I do not have anything bad to say, travelled with my 3 kids, 11,16,19 and my husband. More than enough room, kitchen with full size fridge, comfy beds (the sofa sleeper mattress was a little thin my son said) would be the only little complaint. They had a full hot breakfast every day and Mon-Thurs. they even had dinner, I expected snacks when I read they had this not a full course meal that it was.Excellant staff that went out of there way.Excellant value for us as a family of 5, and was very close to strip no noise from airport but was close, car rental place wihin walking distance, free parking ,outlet mall and other mall super close. shuttles provided if needed to strip or airport...Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-great value”
Reviews.Author: Ballyloves2travel
Reviews.Content: Suite rooms very nice- comfy bed. Breakfast crowded but lots of options for everyone.plus is the free shuttle to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: nieceyeffbaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my boyfriend. We frequent Las Vegas, and this was a nice break from the strip traffic. The room was very clean, neat, and very nice. The bed was sssssoooooo comfortable. They offer complimentary breakfast, and we went 2 of the 3 mornings that we stayed there. It was ok, but how many other hotels in Vegas offer this? I think it is a nice option. Parking was free and closeby. The staff was very friendly and worked with my request for late check-out. This is a great hotel for someone looking to get away from the strip and trying to pay an affordable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: turfclan
Reviews.Content: If yoru plans don't include the Strip or late night clubbing, this is a great place to stay. Located 2 blocks from the airport car rental center, it is makes the car return shuffle easier. Interstate I-115 is 2 minutes away and connects to I-15. Plenty of good resturants close by. This hotel has the Homewood Suites typical settup and the staff are very business traveler friendly. We saw BYU's girl softball team at breakfast and also a mix of family and business travelers. Jet noise is present, but not really a factor in the rooms. The two bedroom suites are great for families or colleagues who have to travel together. NO slots in the lobby. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For Those Seeking Refuge From Strip”
Reviews.Author: grtfultravels
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights on the strip with my older children and then 2 nights at the Homewood Suites by the airport. This allowed us to be in the heart of the strip to see all of the attractions and shows, but then get away from the insanity for our last couple of days since we planned 1 day to see Hoover Dam and 1 day to hike at Red Rock Canyon. The Homewood Suites was perfect for our needs. The 2 room suite was spacious and clean. The facility was secure. The close access to the highway made for easy trips to both Hoover Dam and Red Rocks. The hotel is surrounded by a business park with nothing special surrounding the hotel. But if you have a rental car, it's only a 5 minute drive to restaurants and the Las Vegas Outlet shopping area. The hotel has a free breakfast and dinner as well. Nothing exceptional, but decent if you want something quick. The workout facility was adequate and so was the pool. Again, nothing spectacular, but very functional. Parking was complimentary, ample and secure. The personnel were very friendly. Another perk is that we had an early morning flight the day of our departure. The rental car return facility is very close and this reduced stress by ensuring we had ample time to catch our flight. We did get some highway noise at night, but it was mostly drowned out by the AC system in the room. The noise was NOTHING like the strip. This is a great place for those that want a clean and relaxing place to stay away from the strip. One could drive to and from the strip, but it would require careful timing to avoid peak times on Las Vegas Blvd. Overall, I thought the facility was great and would recommend it to those that want something more than gambling and drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: HImommy
Reviews.Content: Travelling with an extended family and young children, I looked for accommodations close to the airport and away from the strip (and traffic). Homewood Suites is a few blocks from the rental car center, in an industrial area. Not the place for lounging or if you want to be in the middle of the action. Though there is a shuttle that takes you to the airport and Mandalay Bay, having a car is useful. LIKED: having 2-bed/2-bath accommodations for extended family; friendly and pleasant employees, from the front desk to the breakfast guys; cleanliness of the suite; secured outer doors requiring room keys; free breakfast (not the greatest, but enough variety); location away from strip, yet nearby to stores and restaurants; business center to print out boarding passes; in/out access from Gilespie; convenient to I-15 and 215 entrance/exit. WOULD HAVE LIKED: more laundry facilities (only 2 washers/2 dryers); been provided more towels in room (only 2 full sets for 4 people) and a sponge in the kitchen. For our sightseeing purposes in and around Las Vegas, the Homewood Suites was convenient and perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grahamwarrior
Reviews.Content: This hotel would definitely warrant a full 5 stars - two small problems. The hotel is slightly off the beaten track and half the taxi drivers dont know where it is and drive round helplessly trying to find it. Secondly, the bedroom is plush, well furnished and looks wonderful, but the bed is pretty hard. Of course that suits a lot of people, but sadly not me. Service was friendly, the room was cleaned properly and facilities were every bit as good as the Signature Suites were we stayed last time and of course it was about half the price. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem 0N Hidden Well in Las Vegas....”
Reviews.Author: cfrankcostamesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and we can't say enough nice things about it! It is the nicest Homewood Suites (rooms) we have stayed at in the country...and we have stayed at alot of them!! We stay long term normally because of business travel..The rooms are very nice and beautifully decorated to say the least...we had a 2 bedroom and it was FANTASTIC! The G.M. was extremely nice and the front desk people were very kind and helpful to. Great that they have a shuttle EVERY 30 minutes to the Mandalay Bay Hotel..which we did make use of also.. It is a hidden gem in Las Vegas and we are glad we found it.....we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Makettle
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect off the strip hotel. The rooms are huge and clean and quiet. We have used this hotel twice now as a jumping off point for road trips in the Southwest. Airfare to Las Vegas is realitly cheap. Much less expensive than to LAX or Phoenix. Airport car rentals are a 5 min walk away from this hotel. Just make sure you have the address and maybe a printout map for the location of this hotel. Because even though it is only about two minutes form the airport, the taxi drivers don't seem to know where the street is located!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay outside of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: canucks70
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a place to stay near the airport for our last night. Luckily I prebooked this room as it was full when we got there. The place was conveniently located near the rental car center and airport. When we walked in to the room my son already said it was better than the hotel we stayed in on the strip. It was a nice suite with a kitchen.. Room had a nice King bed and comfortable sofabed for my kids. Room was very clean and new looking. The highlight was the full breakfast that was included in the morning. Kudos to the kitchen staff for keeping up with the big surge of guests rushing in for Food!! Only thing I mentioned to my wife which was small was we brought back in the putters (yes they have a putting green!!) that someone else left outside. The person at the desk who tooked them (looked like the manager) could've been a bit more friendlier...

Reviews.Title: “Great value - clean, comfortable, convenient & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rwchicago
Reviews.Content: I flew to the Las Vegas airport to begin a weeklong road trip to the national parks, and this hotel was one of the nicest places I stayed. The room was great, very comfortable, very clean and seemed new. It even had a nice kitchenette, which I didn't need to use since I only stayed one night. I appreciated the friendly helpful staff - Mary Kay at the front desk, and Miguel the shuttle driver. (The hotel has a convenient free shuttle that runs 24 hours to both the the airport and the strip.) I would stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good base near airport with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Merlin5
Reviews.Content: We arrived for one night having just flown in from London prior to leaving early the next morning on our road trip across SW USA. We were staying on Hilton points so the room cost us nothing. Check in was friendly and helpful - there is no restaurant at this hotel but they are happy to not only direct you to local eateries but also offered the free use of the hotel shuttle when we asked for a taxi. The shuttle took us to the restaurant and also came and picked us up when we phoned to say we were ready - this was an unexpected and most welcome service offered by the hotel. The room was clean and spacious and had everything we could need. It is not near the strip but this was not the purpose of our stay - we just wanted somewhere near the airport as a base to crash for the night after our long flight. Breakfast choices are very limited but were perfectly sufficient for our needs. Again, the staff were professional and helpful and very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: barbaradetz
Reviews.Content: Although we had a bit of a time finding the hotel, it was definitely the right choice to stay. The suite was clean and comfortable, and the staff was courteous and helpful. The layout of accommodations was beautiful and well-equipped. There was a nearby shopping and we were not far from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SusieEK
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay for our last night after touring around Las Vegas and Southern Utah. We were only sorry we hadn't been able to stay here longer. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite. This was actually the nicest room we had stayed in during our 11 day vacation, which included an earlier stay at the Four Seasons. The hotel has a shuttle that takes you to Mandalay Bay every hour, so it is convenient to get to the strip and all the excitement, but it is also great for sleeping in a quiet location without people in the halls at all hours of the night. I would highly recommend this hotel for families. The pool and jacuzzi are just right and the included breakfast and nightly manager's reception make this hotel a real bargain. The rooms were spotless and the kids had their own beds and bathroom. This is definitely the way to do Vegas and I can't wait to book a longer stay here.

Reviews.Title: “View from a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: Affe
Reviews.Content: This review is based on wheelchair accessibility ONLY (rating, too). COMMON AREAS All common areas are accessible. ROOM (handicap room no. 441) This room is of course carpeted. The kitchen is somehow adapted for the disabled. This room has a (low) bathtub. STAFF HELPFULNESS (July 2009) None. At that time, the receptionists were clueless, except one lady. GENERAL RATING (not related to accessibility) Very good. Great rooms. At that time (July 2009) the hotel had just opened, I hope the staff is better trained by now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but getting around is a hassle.”
Reviews.Author: imbrue001
Reviews.Content: As long as you don't need a great view, this hotel is in a nice location off-strip. Yes you can hear the airplanes faintly but it isn't anything that will keep you up at night. The bed is very comfortable and the fan above the bed is great if things get steamy. The room w/ it's amenities is pretty perfect for two people. Free breakfast is a nice touch and the staff, especially the management, do a wonderful job at trying to accommodate your needs. Free slow-speed internet in the business center and in room if you have a laptop. The only real gripe I have is that the shuttle schedule is not made clear. Yes the shuttle CAN run 24/7, going to the airport at the top of the hour and to Mandalay Bay at the half hour. But you have to call for it. The shuttle only runs automatically to the airport or to the strip if someone at the hotel requests it. So that means if you need to be picked up at the airport at 2:00pm or from Mandalay Bay at 2:30pm, you need to call them at 1:45pm or 2:15pm respectively, or get lucky. If you go by what hotel staff will tell you, naturally you assume the schedule is automatic. And so what happens is you are waiting for the 2:30pm shuttle at Mandalay Bay to come pick you up..they don't come..and so at 2:35pm you call them to ask if the shuttle is coming. Then they so no, you have to request it. Then you get to wait around for another hour for the next "officially requested" shuttle to show up. This is all way more confusing/annoying then it needs to be. Yes I would stay here again but I would definitely just rent a car for the majority of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Xtaline
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding in 2008 as the property just opened. I was concerned about it being so close to the airport since I'm a light sleeper but we never had an issue. The manager's reception was nice, as was the pool, and the little mini putting green. They is a grill too if you feel so inclined to cook. It was great having the kitchen during our 5 day stay, also the free internet was nice. The shuttle only takes you to Mandalay Bay which was fine because you can get where you need to go from there. My only complaint was drinking the water. We both got mild "d" and after a few days we found out the front desk was giving out free bottles of water, so we were irked that we were not told this at check in!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok....”
Reviews.Author: SovietPanda
Reviews.Content: Homewood was a nice hotel. Service was great. Rooms were big, and clean, but they were dark. It looks pretty dated, too. I'm not sure how old it is, but it looks OLD. We couldn't see any of the Strip, or the city-- or lights, for that matter-- from our room. Not even a little bit. Just all desert. A limo or taxi would pass by every now and then, but that was it. There was also this mysterious white, crusty, stain on the office chair. I'll give Homewood the benefit of the doubt and assume it was ice cream...

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for one night (actually just a few hours) while traveling by myself and transitting in Las Vegas and this hotel fit the bill nicely. Before I arrived in Las Vegas, I called the hotel to make sure a shuttle could pick me up. The receptionist told me they only went to the airport at the top of the hour (it goes to the strip on the half hour). He said a taxi would be $12 because they have a minimum fare. But he also said I could take a rental car shuttle to the rental car center and call the hotel which is just next door and they would pick me up in one minute. I found it kind of odd that an airport hotel would run a shuttle only once an hour but appreciated that he offered me alternatives. Anyway, I arrived in Las Vegas at 1:15 am and called the hotel front desk. The receptionist said the shuttle was available and she would send it right out. It arrived ten minutes later, which was a nice surprise. The hotel is located a little over a mile from the airport--its location near the rental car center tells you it's pretty close to the terminals. But it's in a quiet area and there was no aircraft noise. The room itself was clean and modern, with a full kitchen (service for four), small dining table, sitting area with sofa, etc. Neutrogena toiletries in the bathroom. Free internet, plenty of free parking. Free boarding pass printout in the business center. The receptionist was very nice, and since I was leaving before they started to serve breakfast, offered to make sure there was coffee in the morning. After a few hours' sleep I caught the 5 am shuttle bus back to the airport. Nice hotel, nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with Family - Homewood is the place to go.”
Reviews.Author: StuckOnThe50
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites is the place to go when traveling with family. Looking for a hotel off the strip for a few days. If you are looking for the strip/gambling this is not the location for you. The hotel is near an industrial area close to car return facilities by McCarren. Traveling over Christmas and this location was filled. Unable to get the two bedroom suite but settled for a one bedroom suite. Traveling with two children (used the pull out sofa bed). Free internet (no wifi), fridge, sink, plates, utensil, microwave in the room. Full breakfast (waffles, eggs, meat, bread, fruits, cereal, juices, milk etc) in the morning. Did not stay for the managers dinners in the evening. Free parking - Fitness room and laundry room (dryer - $1.00 for an hour) - swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “A-maz-ing!”
Reviews.Author: OutletTripster
Reviews.Content: I went here to see the lights, and I did! I found this trip very interesting and fun... The very important thing was going to the las vegas strip. There's a shuttle going to Mandalay Bay and you go on from there. The best thing they can pick you up anytime you just give them a call and they will pick you up in 5-10 min... Theie breakfast are delicious and fun! They're mostly the same as all the hilton family hotels but in this one you can make your own waffle and bake or toast it yourself. The attractions that I recommend is if you have kids, take them to M&M World at MGM Grand, if your just a couple go sight seeing at the hotels like, The Luxor, and The Venitian. If you're a shopaholic also go to the Venitian and The Las Vegas Premium Outlets... Anyways this hotel was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: wichitaFallsMomof2
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my kids, my parents and my brother (family trip) The hotel is very nice. the staff was great. We had some miscommunication with the shuttle, but that's ok. the service made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mn700vforce
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom suit with four adults total. Each room had its own bathroom. There were nice 32” flat screen TV’S in each bedroom and one in the living room. Room were clean and looked nice and modern. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The free continental breakfast was good. Hotels location was good if you have a car. It is only about a Mile to the strip and there are a lot of choices for dinning and shopping within a mile of the hotel. Would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the spot”
Reviews.Author: SWMDL60
Reviews.Content: October in Las Vegas was great – although the sun was still a bit strong, the temperature was perfect. We participated in an outdoor sporting event but we didn’t combust in to ashes like we almost did in August (don’t ask what we were thinking). When we checked in, there were two people working at the lobby hence processing two sets of guests at a time. I wasn’t worried too much about the security issue since I was with two Chippendale types (ok, not exactly) but the staff who processed us (Brady, I think and I believe he is the manager) was alert/cautious/discreet enough not to read out and announce our room number when he gave us the room key there – I was very happy with the hotel from the get go because of that. It turned out Brady is a hardworking (and/or overworking) guy - he was there when we checked in, during our stay, and when we checked out. I hope he is getting paid well. He was doing a great job. We booked a non-smoking, 2 bedrooms/2 baths suite for 3 adults and 3 children. In our room, 245, 2 bedrooms were joined by a small kitchen/dining/living room. There is a full size refrigerator in the kitchen that we packed it with snacks and drinks. The room was also equipped with a coffee maker, a microwave oven and even a toaster, stove and dishwasher. This hotel is not a smoke free hotel but we weren’t bothered by any smoke smell at all. The room windows were at the freeway side and the traffic noise was a bit loud for me; but it was no issue for the rest of the group. The airport noise didn’t bother us at all. The complimentary breakfast was great; it accommodated light to heavy eaters like fruit to burritos. The kitchen staff was efficient and they kept the food well stocked and countertops and tables clean. The swimming pool was heated and the children were very happy dipping in the early nippy morning. This hotel suited and satisfied our trip needs; price, amenity and location. If your Las Vegas stay is mainly non-gaming, this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Planerides
Reviews.Content: This is a great airport hotel. It offer great value along with a super efficient free shuttle bus service to and from the airport along with Mandalay Bay. Our room was spacious and clean. The free breakfast in the morning was a pleasant suprise. There were eggs, bacon, waffles, cereal, fruit, & toast (not your usual continental breakfast affair). The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this airport hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacation242
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, off the strip but not so far, a plus that they have a shuttle that takes and picks you up from THE MANDALAY BAY. The room decor was really trendy and clean, and the bed was to die for. The kitchen was impressive for a room and had all that one needs. Quiet and spacious room. A yummy breakfast in the morning with good variety (However u have to wake up sorta early to get the best of the layout) Regular pool but very clean, and even though it is 5 min from the airport I slept like a babe and could not hear anything. Will be booking again whenever I go to Vegas again hands down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: DeltaShuttle192
Reviews.Content: This hotel from what I understand is roughly one year old, the hotel seems very new. The hotel and the area are fairly quiet for the exception of the airport noise. Its located at the exit of the terminal of the aiport so a I imagine wouldnt cost much to get there. I'd like to stress that this hotel is NOT walking distance to anything other than the rental car center which would be about a 5 to 10 minute walk. They do have shuttle service, however it only takes you to mandalay bay and picks up there. Overall Id come back if I wanted value but not convience (not there fault)

Reviews.Title: “I"ve Been Spoiled!!”
Reviews.Author: cheriecakez
Reviews.Content: OK...I loved this place!!!..Here is my review...Short and Sweet...I was traveling alone...leary of many things....I looked and looked and found this hotel online and after reading the reviews I thought I'd sleep on it and decide in the morning.....Well....I'm glad I did! This place had the most spotlessly clean and fresh smelling new rooms you could imagine...The bathroom was just like home...it was designed beautifully. The shower had a shower massage head that felt like a dream!... FULL FORCED WATER!....no little drips that you had to run under to catch and get aggravated with and when all was said and done it felt like you needed a shower!!!...It was a pleasure to fall sleep on a new beautiful clean king size bed!...just like home!...No smoke smell anywhere...Not a drop of noise in the place...any where...Full kitchen...Coffee (or tea) in the morning without having to get dressed and go out!...OMG! Fantastic...Secure building with a very friendly and helpfull staff!... Just one phone call to the front desk and you have the shuttle to take you to the strip!...there's so much more!... I would recomend this hotel to ANYONE who appreciates a home away from home...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jancowan
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling by car to Las Vegas, this hotel can not be beat. It is just south of the Airport (no noise though) and near to a Whole Food Market. The main problem with the Strip hotels is that there is always traffic jams, no matter the time of day and hotel parking is a fair distance from your room, usually meaning a trip via the casino to get to the guest elevators. At Homewood Suites, no traffic jams and parking is simple, right outside the door. The one bedroom suite has a kitchenette and living area. The breakfast is the usual fair, during the week they do provide evening meals, but we did not sample them. All in all, if you have transport, this hotel provides all that you need at a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but unhappy with service”
Reviews.Author: Katsy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed for one night at the end of a trip outside the US. The property is very nice but we were not happy with the service. Half-way through the designated breakfast time, much of the food ran out....excuse was that they didn't expect to be so busy. That excuse is not acceptable. Next issue is that before going to breakfast we took our bags to the car, leaving only a couple of items in the room, including some medication that is taken after eating. The maid was not on the floor when we left the room. While we were out the room was cleaned...even though we had not checked out. The maid put the few items that we left on the bathroom vanity into a bag and had it on her cart, however the medication was gone. It had been thrown away. This action was also not acceptable. This is a nice place but does not appear to have good management. For that reason we do not recommend this property

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous comfort and value.”
Reviews.Author: Addicked
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here in the middle of our trip and were pleasantly surprised. The suites were large, the furnishings excellent and the beds the most comfortable of our entire trip. OK, you don't get the service of the top hotels but for the price it's hard to beat. The complimentary breakfast was great, and they offer a shuttle service to the strip, which makes up for the location. Highly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Las Vegas Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 230 Hidden Well Road, Las Vegas, NV 89119
